feed.title: Track Awesome Shell Updates Weekly
feed.subtitle: A curated list of awesome command-line frameworks, toolkits, guides and gizmos. Inspired by awesome-php.

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Feb 19 - Feb 25, 2024
entry.content:
Command-Line Productivity

  • autoenv (‚≠ê5.9k) - Directory-based environments.

Downloading and Serving / Directory Navigation

  • tshare (‚≠ê135) - File sharing from commandline.
entry.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Feb 19 - Feb 25, 2024

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Feb 12 - Feb 18, 2024
entry.content:
Shells

  • yash (‚≠ê454) - A POSIX-compliant command line shell with built-in support for completion and prediction based on command history

Command-Line Productivity

  • ok-sh (‚≠ê96) - Do you work on many different projects? And in each project, are there commands you use that are specific to that project? You need a .ok file.

Downloading and Serving / Directory Navigation

  • Kapow! (‚≠ê619) - If you can script it, you can HTTP it.

Shell Script Development / See also

  • awesome-bash (‚≠ê8.7k)
entry.summary: 4 awesome projects updated on Feb 12 - Feb 18, 2024

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Nov 06 - Nov 12, 2023
entry.content:
Shells

  • murex (‚≠ê1.6k) - A smarter shell and scripting environment with advanced features designed for usability, safety and productivity (eg smarter DevOps tooling)

Command-Line Productivity

  • xiki (‚≠ê3.8k) - Makes the shell console more friendly and powerful

Downloading and Serving / Directory Navigation

  • yt-dlp (‚≠ê118k) - Command-line program to download videos from YouTube.com and other video sites

Multimedia and File Formats / Directory Navigation

  • library (‚≠ê432) - Create SQLITE databases for folders of music, video, images, or online media. Play and track media like Plex but a CLI-only interface with many sorting options.

Shell Script Development / Directory Navigation

  • Bash Hackers Wiki
entry.summary: 5 awesome projects updated on Nov 06 - Nov 12, 2023

entry.content:

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on May 29 - Jun 04, 2023
entry.content:
Command-Line Productivity

  • broot (‚≠ê12k) - A better way to navigate directories
  • tere (‚≠ê1.8k) - A faster alternative to cd + ls

Customization / Directory Navigation

  • polyglot (‚≠ê188) - An informative Git prompt that works in bash, zsh, ksh, mksh, pdksh, oksh, dash, yash, busybox sh, and osh
entry.summary: 3 awesome projects updated on May 29 - Jun 04, 2023

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Dec 26 - Jan 01, 2022
entry.content:
Command-Line Productivity

  • arttime (‚≠ê1.1k) - Beauty of text art meets functionality of clock, timer, pomodoro++ time manager
  • await (‚≠ê172) - single binary that run list of commands in parallel and waits for their termination
  • lf (‚≠ê8.4k) - Terminal file manager written in Go, inspired by ranger

Customization / Directory Navigation

  • aphrodite-terminal-theme (‚≠ê158) ‚Äî Minimalistic Aphrodite theme (prompt) for sexy terminals that works in bash, fish and zsh

For Developers / Directory Navigation

  • 1Password SSH Agent - Authenticate Git and SSH workflows with biometric unlock using 1Password
  • nve (‚≠ê705) - Run any command on specific Node.js versions.
  • trunk - Blazingly fast meta code checker and formatter
  • vmn (‚≠ê64) - git-based automatic versioning and state recovery solution agnostic to language or architecture

Multimedia and File Formats / Directory Navigation

  • dzr (‚≠ê219) - Cross-platform Deezer.com audio player.
entry.summary: 9 awesome projects updated on Dec 26 - Jan 01, 2022

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Apr 25 - May 01, 2022
entry.content:
System Utilities / Directory Navigation

  • btop (‚≠ê26k) - Linux/OSX/FreeBSD resource monitor
  • lsd (‚≠ê15k) - LSDeluxe, rewrite of GNU ls with lot of added features like colors, icons, tree-view and more formatting options.
entry.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Apr 25 - May 01, 2022

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Feb 21 - Feb 27, 2022
entry.content:
Command-Line Productivity

  • bartib (‚≠ê753) - A simple timetracker for the command line. It saves a log of all tracked activities as a plaintext file and allows you to create flexible reports.
  • lowcharts (‚≠ê224) - Draw low-resolution graphs in terminal

Customization / Directory Navigation

  • oh-my-posh - Prompt theme engine for any shell and platform written in go.

System Utilities / Directory Navigation

  • tiptop (‚≠ê1.9k) - Graphical command-line system monitor.

Shell Script Development / Directory Navigation

  • bashly - Bash command line framework and CLI generator
  • bash-modules (‚≠ê139) - functions for developing with unofficial strict mode enabled.
  • composure (‚≠ê338) - Compose, document, version and organize your shell functions
  • dispatch (‚≠ê89) - A command line argument parser in 50 lines of portable shell script.
  • getopts.fish (‚≠ê227) - CLI parser for fish
entry.summary: 9 awesome projects updated on Feb 21 - Feb 27, 2022

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Aug 30 - Sep 05, 2021
entry.content:
For Developers / Directory Navigation

  • gita (‚≠ê1.8k) - A command-line tool to manage multiple git repos.

Downloading and Serving / Directory Navigation

  • xh (‚≠ê6.6k) - Friendly and fast tool for sending HTTP requests

Applications / Directory Navigation

  • ticker (‚≠ê5.3k) ‚Äî Terminal stock ticker with live updates and position tracking
entry.summary: 3 awesome projects updated on Aug 30 - Sep 05, 2021

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Jun 07 - Jun 13, 2021
entry.content:
Shells

  • ngs (‚≠ê1.5k) - Fully featured scripting language created specifically for Ops. REPL is being developed.
  • powershell a cross-platform task automation and configuration management framework, consisting of a command-line shell and scripting language

Command-Line Productivity

  • pass - Manage passwords from the command line with GPG encryption and optional git integration.
  • usql (‚≠ê9.4k) - Universal command-line interface for SQL databases.
  • xplr (‚≠ê4.5k) - A hackable, minimal, fast TUI file explorer

Customization / Directory Navigation

  • starship - Fast, customisable, cross-shell prompt written in rust

For Developers / Directory Navigation

  • just (‚≠ê26k) - Task runner for saving and running project-specific commands.

System Utilities / Directory Navigation

  • prettyping (‚≠ê1.2k) - Making the output of ping prettier, more colorful, more compact, and easier to read.

Multimedia and File Formats / Directory Navigation

  • yq (‚≠ê14k) - yq is a portable command-line YAML processor

Applications / Directory Navigation

  • pcalc (‚≠ê566) - Calculator made for programmers working with multiple number representations, sizes, and overall close to the bits.

Shell Script Development / Directory Navigation

  • bashew (‚≠ê280) - bash script creator - from small stand-alone script to complex projects with CI/CD and testing
  • getoptions (‚≠ê456) - An elegant option parser for shell scripts (sh, bash and all POSIX shells)
  • shfmt (‚≠ê7.8k) - A shell parser, formatter, and interpreter with bash support; includes shfmt
  • Shell Field Guide
entry.summary: 14 awesome projects updated on Jun 07 - Jun 13, 2021

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Mar 29 - Apr 04, 2021
entry.content:
Multimedia and File Formats / Directory Navigation

  • dasel (‚≠ê7.5k) - Query and update data structures using selectors from the command line. Comparable to jq (‚≠ê32k) / yq (‚≠ê2.8k) but supports JSON, YAML, TOML and XML with zero runtime dependencies.

Applications / Directory Navigation

  • editly (‚≠ê5k) - Command line video editor
entry.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Mar 29 - Apr 04, 2021

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Nov 02 - Nov 08, 2020
entry.content:
Shells

  • es - The extensible shell, based on Plan 9's rc (‚≠ê289) shell

Command-Line Productivity

  • undollar (‚≠ê190) - undollar bites the dollar sign off the tip of the command you just pasted into your terminal

Command-Line Productivity / Directory Navigation

  • zpyi (‚≠ê109) - Python in Zsh - Easy python scripting in shell

Applications / Directory Navigation

  • dstask (‚≠ê888) - Single binary terminal-based TODO manager with git-based sync + markdown notes per task

Shell Script Development / Directory Navigation

  • shellspec (‚≠ê1.2k) - A full-featured BDD unit testing framework for dash, bash, ksh, zsh and all POSIX shells
entry.summary: 5 awesome projects updated on Nov 02 - Nov 08, 2020

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Oct 12 - Oct 18, 2020
entry.content:
Customization / Directory Navigation

  • powerlevel10k (‚≠ê50k) - Super flexible awesome powerline ZSH theme

System Utilities / Directory Navigation

  • ccat (‚≠ê3.2k) - ccat is the colorizing cat. It works similar to cat but displays content with syntax highlighting.

Downloading and Serving / Directory Navigation

  • httpie (‚≠ê36k) - HTTPie is a command line HTTP client, a user-friendly cURL replacement

Applications / Directory Navigation

  • kanban.bash (‚≠ê920) - commandline asciii kanban board for minimalist productivity bash hackers (csv-based)

Shell Script Development / Directory Navigation

  • powscript (‚≠ê163) - bash transpiler written in bash (coffeescript for bash)
  • Bash Official Reference Manual
  • The Linux Documentation Project: Bash Programming - Intro/How-to
  • The Linux Documentation Project: Advanced Bash Scripting Guide

Command-Line Productivity / Directory Navigation

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Jul 06 - Jul 12, 2020
entry.content:
Command-Line Productivity / Directory Navigation

  • aliasme (‚≠ê116) - alias helper to change directory quickly
  • autojump (‚≠ê17k) - A cd command that learns - easily navigate directories from the command line
  • bashmarks (‚≠ê1.9k) - Directory bookmarks for the shell
  • bd (‚≠ê926) - Quickly go back to a parent directory
  • commacd (‚≠ê367) - A faster way to move around in Bash
  • enhancd (‚≠ê2.6k) - üöÄ A next-generation cd command with an interactive filter
  • goto (‚≠ê892) - A shell utility for navigation to aliased directories supporting auto-completion
  • jump (‚≠ê1.9k) - Jump helps you navigate your file system faster by learning your habits.
  • lazy-cd (‚≠ê23) - Simple bash commands for bookmarked navigation of the file system, complete with bash-completion.
  • up (‚≠ê178) - Ascend directories by name or count; for bash, zsh, and fish.
entry.summary: 10 awesome projects updated on Jul 06 - Jul 12, 2020

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Apr 13 - Apr 19, 2020
entry.content:
Shells

  • nushell (‚≠ê36k) - A modern shell written in Rust

Command-Line Productivity

  • byobu - Text-based window manager and terminal multiplexer
  • xxh (‚≠ê5.7k) - Bring your favorite shell wherever you go through the SSH.

System Utilities / Directory Navigation

  • maza (‚≠ê1.8k) - Local ad blocker. Like Pi-hole but local and using your operating system.

Shell Script Development / Directory Navigation

  • critic.sh (‚≠ê457) - Dead simple testing framework for Bash with coverage reporting

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Mar 09 - Mar 15, 2020
entry.content:
Shells

  • ion (‚≠ê1.5k) - A modern system shell that features a simple, yet powerful, syntax. It is written entirely in Rust.

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Mar 02 - Mar 08, 2020
entry.content:
Command-Line Productivity

  • boom (‚≠ê1.3k) - Store links and snippets in the command line
  • cod (‚≠ê535) ‚Äî A completion daemon for shell that learns when you invoke --help commands
  • dnote (‚≠ê2.9k) - A simple command line notebook with multi-device sync and web interface
  • foxy (‚≠ê44) - Plain text bookmarks for Firefox and surf browsers.
  • resh (‚≠ê1k) - Contextual shell history for Zsh and Bash
  • snips (‚≠ê85) - Command line tool to manage snippets of code.

For Developers / Directory Navigation

  • mkdkr (‚≠ê378) - Makefile + Docker = CI Pipeline

Downloading and Serving / Directory Navigation

  • bashhub-server (‚≠ê312) - Private cloud shell history. Open source server for bashhub
entry.summary: 8 awesome projects updated on Mar 02 - Mar 08, 2020

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Jan 20 - Jan 26, 2020
entry.content:
Shells

  • zsh - Powerful shell with scripting language

Command-Line Productivity

  • eureka (‚≠ê828) - üí° CLI tool to input and store your ideas without leaving the terminal
  • gitmux (‚≠ê669) - Show Git status in Tmux status bar
  • parallel - Build and execute shell command lines from standard input in parallel
  • tmux - Amazing terminal multiplexer

Customization / Directory Navigation

  • geometry (‚≠ê966) - A minimal ZSH theme where any function can be added to the left prompt or (async) right prompt on the fly.
  • synth-shell (‚≠ê1.1k) - Greeter with a customizable status report and a fancy bash prompt

System Utilities / Directory Navigation

  • lnav - An advanced log file viewer for the small-scale

Shell Package Management / Directory Navigation

  • bpkg - JavaScript has npm, Ruby has Gems, Python has pip and now Shell has bpkg

Shell Script Development / Directory Navigation

  • Greg Wooledge's (aka "greycat") wiki. Specifically Bash Guide, Bash FAQ and Bash Pitfalls
entry.summary: 10 awesome projects updated on Jan 20 - Jan 26, 2020

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Oct 28 - Nov 03, 2019
entry.content:
Shells

  • ksh93 (‚≠ê584) - Korn Shell
  • mksh (‚≠ê227) - MirBSD Korn Shell
  • oksh (‚≠ê390) - Portable OpenBSD ksh
  • pdksh - Public domain Korn shell
  • shell++ (‚≠ê163) - Friendly and modern functional and object oriented shell script language
  • tcsh - C shell with file name completion and command line editing
  • xonsh - Python-ish, BASHwards-looking shell language and command prompt

Command-Line Productivity

  • browsh (‚≠ê18k) - The modern text-based browser
  • googlr (‚≠ê50) - Command line tool that lets you search Google from your terminal.
  • mcfly (‚≠ê7.3k) - Fly through your shell history. Great Scot!
  • sqlline (‚≠ê640) - Shell for issuing SQL to relational databases via JDBC (multiline, completion, highlighting, dialect support)
  • td-cli (‚≠ê204) - A todo command line manager to organize and manage your todos across multiple projects.

Command-Line Productivity / Directory Navigation

  • z.lua (‚≠ê3.1k) - A new cd command that helps you navigate faster by learning your habits

For Developers / Directory Navigation

  • ack - A grep-like search tool optimized for source code.
  • bitwise (‚≠ê680) - Terminal based interactive bit manipulator in curses.
  • forgit (‚≠ê4.7k) - Utility tool for git taking advantage of fuzzy finder fzf.
  • overcommit (‚≠ê4k) - A fully configurable and extendable Git hook manager
  • wipe-modules (‚≠ê352) - A little agent that removes the node_modules folder of non-active projects

System Utilities / Directory Navigation

  • bat (‚≠ê53k) - A cat clone with wings
  • exa (‚≠ê24k) - A modern version of ls.
  • nmtui (‚≠ê444) - Text User Interface for controlling NetworkManager

Multimedia and File Formats / Directory Navigation

  • jo (‚≠ê4.8k) - A small utility to create JSON objects from command-line arguments.

Applications / Directory Navigation

  • jrnl (‚≠ê6.7k) - A simple command line journal application that stores your journal in a plain text file

Shell Package Management / Directory Navigation

  • yadm - Git-based dotfiles manager supporting encryption, alternates, and bootstrapping

Shell Script Development / Directory Navigation

  • bashful (‚≠ê610) - A collection of libraries to simplify writing Bash scripts
  • Bashlets (‚≠ê77) - A modular extensible toolbox for Bash
  • Fishtape (‚≠ê355) - TAP producer and test harness for fish
entry.summary: 27 awesome projects updated on Oct 28 - Nov 03, 2019

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Oct 22 - Oct 28, 2018
entry.content:
Shells

  • osh - Bash compatible, with new/modern Unix shell language called Oil

Command-Line Productivity

  • fselect (‚≠ê4.3k) - Find files with SQL-like queries.
  • loop (‚≠ê683) - Write and control complex loops with as one-liners
  • xsv (‚≠ê11k) - a fast CSV command line toolkit written in Rust

Downloading and Serving / Directory Navigation

  • shell2http (‚≠ê1.4k) - HTTP-server to execute shell commands. Designed for development, prototyping or remote control

Applications / Directory Navigation

  • carbon-now-cli (‚≠ê5.9k) - üé® Beautiful images of your code ‚Äî from right inside your terminal.

Games / Directory Navigation

  • SHTAP - Reusable text adventure engine for Bash 4

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Sep 03 - Sep 09, 2018
entry.content:
Shells

  • elvish - Friendly, expressive shell features like anonymous functions and data structures
  • shenv (‚≠ê45) - Simple shell version management

Command-Line Productivity

  • fd (‚≠ê39k) - A simple, fast and user-friendly alternative to find.
  • Lmod - Lua-based Environment Modules that enhances Tcl-based modules while being backward compatible (compare to modules)
  • shell-history (‚≠ê114) - Visualize your shell usage with Highcharts
  • surfraw - browse specific site and search the web from your terminal without browser.

For Developers / Directory Navigation

  • add-gitignore (‚≠ê695) - Interactive CLI that generates a .gitignore for your project based on your needs.
  • mr - Multiple Repository management tool

System Utilities / Directory Navigation

  • rng (‚≠ê33) - Copy range of lines from file or stdin to stdout.
  • wifi-wand (‚≠ê71) - a Ruby command line application for managing WiFi on MacOS (install by gem install wifi-wand)

Multimedia and File Formats / Directory Navigation

  • korkut (‚≠ê380) - Quick and simple image processing at the command line.

Applications / Directory Navigation

  • md2png (‚≠ê37) - Convert markdown to PNG image
  • whales (‚≠ê391) - A tool to automatically dockerize your applications
entry.summary: 13 awesome projects updated on Sep 03 - Sep 09, 2018

entry.title: Awesome Shell Updates on Jun 15 - Jun 21, 2015
entry.content:
Command-Line Productivity

  • ag (‚≠ê27k) - Super fast string search through a directory hierarchy
  • fasd (‚≠ê5.9k) - Command-line productivity booster, offers quick access to files and directories
  • hhighlighter (‚≠ê478) - Colorize words in a command output
  • hr (‚≠ê1.3k) - <hr /> for your terminal
  • hstr (‚≠ê4.2k) - Bash History Suggest Box
  • percol (‚≠ê3.3k) - Adds flavor of interactive filtering to the traditional pipe concept of UNIX shell
  • spark (‚≠ê6k) - ‚ñÅ‚ñÇ‚ñÉ‚ñÖ‚ñÇ‚ñá in your shell
  • sshfs (‚≠ê1.2k) - A tool for mounting remote file systems over SSH
  • v (‚≠ê452) - z for vim.
  • wemux (‚≠ê3.7k) - Multi-User Tmux Made Easy

Customization / Directory Navigation

  • bash-git-prompt (‚≠ê6.8k) - An informative and fancy Bash prompt for Git users
  • git-prompt (‚≠ê326) - Bash prompt with Git, SVN and HG modules
  • sexy-bash-prompt (‚≠ê1.1k) - Bash prompt with colors, Git statuses, and Git branches

For Developers / Directory Navigation

  • git-extra-commands (‚≠ê1.1k) - Many Git extra utilities. Churn, cut-branch, improved-merge and many more.
  • git-semver (‚≠ê388) - Git plugin for easing semantic versioning and changelog validation
  • git-sh (‚≠ê739) - A customized Bash environment suitable for Git work
  • repren (‚≠ê362) - Command-line search-and-replace and file-renaming swiss army knife
  • slap (‚≠ê6.2k) - Sublime-like terminal-based text editor that runs on Node.js
  • shipit (‚≠ê569) - Minimalistic SSH deployment

System Utilities / Directory Navigation

  • lsp (‚≠ê531) - An improved ls, with file descriptions in plain language and intelligent file grouping
  • quick-secure (‚≠ê420) - Quickly secure and harden UNIX/Linux systems

Downloading and Serving / Directory Navigation

  • balls (‚≠ê864) - Bash on Balls
  • bashttpd (‚≠ê1.5k) - A web server written in Bash
  • bitpocket (‚≠ê1k) - "DIY Dropbox" or "2-way directory (r)sync with proper deletion"
  • Dropbox-Uploader (‚≠ê6.6k) - Dropbox Uploader is a Bash script which can be used to upload, download, list or delete files from Dropbox
  • ngincat (‚≠ê180) - Tiny Bash HTTP server using netcat
  • resty (‚≠ê2.7k) - Little command line REST client that you can use in pipelines

Multimedia and File Formats / Directory Navigation

  • Android-Kitchen (‚≠ê1.1k) - A text-based kitchen for Android ROM customization. Uses shell scripts and works with Cygwin/OS X/Linux
  • image-scraper (‚≠ê772) - A cool command line image scraper with a lot of features.
  • jq (‚≠ê32k) - Sed for json data. You can use it to slice and filter and map and transform structured data
  • sejda (‚≠ê528) - Command line manipulation of PDF documents (split, merge, rotate, convert to jpg, extract text, etc)
  • xmlstarlet - Old but powerful tool for command-line XML formatting, filtering, and manipulation.

Applications / Directory Navigation

  • ansiweather (‚≠ê1.9k) - Weather in your terminal, with ANSI colors and Unicode symbols
  • bashblog (‚≠ê1.7k) - A Bash script that handles blog posting
  • geeknote (‚≠ê2.1k) - Command line evernote client
  • ledger (‚≠ê5.6k) - Command line accounting
  • pushblast (‚≠ê98) - Get PushBullet notifications when a shell program exits
  • pushbullet-bash (‚≠ê235) - Bash interface to the PushBullet API
  • wego (‚≠ê8.2k) - Weather app for the terminal

Shell Package Management / Directory Navigation

  • basher (‚≠ê1.2k) - A package manager for shell scripts
  • fresh (‚≠ê1.2k) - Keep your dotfiles fresh
  • homeshick (‚≠ê2.1k) - Git dotfile synchronizer written in Bash

Shell Script Development / Directory Navigation

  • rerun (‚≠ê458) - A modular shell automation framework to organize your keeper scripts
  • semver_bash (‚≠ê263) - Semantic Versioning in Bash
  • shellcheck (‚≠ê38k) - Static analysis tool for shell scripts
  • shpec (‚≠ê382) - A shell testing framework
  • sub (‚≠ê1.8k) - A delicious way to organize programs
  • ts (‚≠ê60) - A shell test script
  • The Art of Command Line (‚≠ê157k)
